definition: to build up public opinion/to create a fuss
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: but at the same time it was really just a buildup in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 但是同時我覺得這只是製造輿論。

sentences.english: The gig was given a big buildup on both press and TV.
sentences.chinese: 爵士演唱會被報刊和電視大造輿論。

sentences.english: Uruguayan football has never failed to generate opinion over the years.
sentences.chinese: 烏拉圭足球這些年來並沒有少製造輿論。

sentences.english: It was just a buildup of consumer expectations, you know, people were expecting more
sentences.chinese: 就是給消費者預期製造輿論，人們期望更多。
